data.title: Taylor A. Marcusson
data.text:
Taylor has a broad and diverse practice, handling complex commercial litigation matters in both state and federal court. She has represented clients in disputes involving consumer class actions, antitrust claims, ERISA, the Mental Health Parity and Addiction Equity Act (MHPAEA), bad faith, the Telephone Consumer Privacy Act and breach of contract. Taylor's litigation experience spans across a multitude of industries, including managed care, transportation, finance and retail.

Taylor is committed to maintaining an active pro bono practice. During law school, she devoted much of her time to clinical work focused on federal appeals, DNA evidence and juvenile life sentencing. In addition, Taylor worked on behalf of Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch, and Global Justice Center on an amici curiae in Dobbs v. Whole Womenâ€™s Health.
